Today, Dan and Jordan take a breakie into the past to see how things are going with Alex in simpler times.  In this installment, Alex does an absolutely terrible job of covering the bombing of the Marriott in Jakarta and takes some calls from some real weirdos.

==Detailed Show Notes==

Topics covered<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2022/9/1/episode-720-august-6-2003 Episode #720: August 6, 2003]</ref>:

*Alex misreports the [https://www.nytimes.com/2003/07/05/world/saudis-quietly-promote-strict-islam-in-indonesia.html circumstances of both] [https://web.archive.org/web/20060911122056/http://merln.ndu.edu/archive/icg/Terrorism5May06.pdf the recent bombing] [http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/asia-pacific/3134179.stm in Jakarta] as well as the 2002 bombings in Bali
*Alex fails to provide any [https://web.archive.org/web/20090326213002/http://www.usindo.org/publications/reports/pdf/WarOnTerror.pdf context regarding advance warnings] about bombings in Indonesia
*Alex misreports [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2002/sep/07/saudiarabia.davidpallister a Guardian story] about [https://www.theguardian.com/uk/2004/feb/27/politics.saudiarabia Saudi Arabia falsely accusing] [https://abcnews.go.com/International/story?id=82105&page=1 British embassy employees] of carrying out bombings
*[http://www.asyura2.com/2002/war17/msg/297.html Alex's source] regarding the US embassy planning to withdraw employees
*[https://web.archive.org/web/20060618005353/http://afp.gov.au/international/operations/previous_operations/bali_bombings_2002 Australian police report] about the bombings
*Alex uses [https://web.archive.org/web/20040219033817/https://www.detik.com/peristiwa/2003/08/05/20030805-183447.shtml a flimsy source] to report that the US embassy canceled reservations at the Marriott in Jakarta hours before the bombing
